title: Matcha Latte – Behind the Scenes
lead: Our Matcha process and sourcing story.
content:
Matcha Latte – Behind the Scenes

At Phuc Long, our Matcha Latte is more than a drink — it's a story of careful sourcing and precise technique. In this piece we walk through each step, from farm to cup.

Sourcing

We partner with smallholder farms that harvest young, tender tea leaves for matcha production. Leaves are shaded before harvest to increase chlorophyll, creating that vivid green and umami-rich flavor.

Processing

Leaves are stone-ground into a fine powder and tested for aroma and color. Our roasters then calibrate the ratio of matcha to milk for consistent texture and sweetness.

How we prepare it

  1. Whisk 1–1.5 tsp matcha with a splash of hot water until frothy.
  2. Add steamed milk and a touch of syrup if desired.

Enjoy it hot or iced—our baristas recommend a 1:3 matcha-to-milk ratio for balance. Want to taste the difference? Try it side-by-side with our single-origin matcha shots.

title: How to Brew the Perfect Black Tea
lead: Step-by-step guide for the best cup.
content:
How to Brew the Perfect Black Tea

Black tea rewards attention. With the right water temperature, steep time, and leaf quality, a perfect cup is easily within reach.

Ingredients & Tools

  • Fresh cold water
  • Loose-leaf black tea (2–3 g per 200ml)
  • Kettle, teapot or infuser

Step-by-step

  1. Heat water: Bring to ~95°C (just below boiling).
  2. Preheat teapot: Rinse your teapot or cup with hot water.
  3. Measure leaves: Use 2–3 g of tea per cup.
  4. Steep time: 3–5 minutes depending on desired strength.

Tasting notes: Short steeping yields floral, delicate notes; longer steeping brings out malty, robust flavors. Try with a splash of milk or a slice of lemon.

Advanced tip

For iced black tea, brew 25% stronger, cool quickly, then pour over ice to retain brightness.

title: Workshop Recap: Latte Art Basics
lead: Photos and tips from our last workshop.
content:
Workshop Recap: Latte Art Basics

Our recent latte art workshop covered essential tools and techniques for building consistent microfoam and simple pours. Below are the key takeaways for home baristas.

Tools we used

  • Steam wand with thermometer
  • Pitcher with narrow spout
  • Fresh espresso (18–20 g dose)

Key techniques

  1. Stretch and texture: introduce air early, then submerge to create microfoam.
  2. Swirl and tap: remove large bubbles and set a silky texture.
  3. Pours: start high for base, then lower the pitcher and move gently for design.

Participants practiced hearts, rosettas, and simple tulips. Photos from the event are available at our store and social feed.

title: Product Deep Dive: Hibiscus Infusion
lead: Explaining the health benefits and flavor profile.
content:
Product Deep Dive: Hibiscus Infusion

Hibiscus is more than a pretty color — it brings tart floral notes and a refreshing acidity that balances sweet elements very well. In this deep dive we explore flavor, sourcing, and serving suggestions.

Flavor profile

Tart, cranberry-like acidity with floral undernotes. Bright and crisp, hibiscus pairs well with stone fruits and citrus.

Health highlights

  • Rich in vitamin C and antioxidants
  • Refreshing and naturally caffeine-free

Serving ideas

  1. Iced hibiscus with mint and lime.
  2. Hibiscus syrup as cocktail or mocktail base.
  3. Pair hibiscus drink with creamy desserts to cut sweetness.

We source hibiscus from vetted suppliers to ensure consistent aroma and color — it’s key to keeping flavor balanced across batches.

title: 5 Ways to Enjoy Iced Tea This Summer
lead: Quick recipes to beat the heat.
content:
5 Ways to Enjoy Iced Tea This Summer

Hot weather calls for refreshing iced tea. Here are five quick recipes you can make at home or try our versions in-store.

1. Classic Mint Iced Tea

Brew strong black tea, cool, add fresh mint and a squeeze of lemon.

2. Peach Iced Tea

Steep tea with peach slices or use peach syrup for a sweeter twist.

3. Hibiscus Cooler

Brew hibiscus flowers, chill, add lime and a touch of honey.

4. Jasmine Green Iced Tea

Delicate floral notes, lightly sweetened — great with light snacks.

5. Citrus Ginger Iced Tea

Add ginger slices and orange peel during steeping for a spicy-citrus kick.

Pro tip: brew slightly stronger than usual (about 1.25x), cool quickly, then serve over ice to keep flavor bright.

title: Sustainability at Phuc Long
lead: How we reduce waste and support farmers.
content:
Sustainability at Phuc Long

Sustainability is central to how we source ingredients and run stores. From supporting responsible farming to reducing single-use waste, here are concrete steps we take.

Farmer partnerships

We work directly with smallholder farmers to improve crop quality and ensure fair prices. Long-term contracts help stabilize income for farming communities.

Waste reduction

  • Encourage reusable cups with a discount.
  • Compost organic waste where possible.
  • Switch to recyclable packaging for takeout.

Continuous improvement

We measure key sustainability indicators yearly and invest in projects that reduce carbon footprint and support farmer resilience. Join us in making small choices that add up — bring your reusable cup on your next visit.
